alert.note: Alert for Northern San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 12:20PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern San Joaquin, northern Stanislaus, west central Calaveras and southwestern Amador Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1216 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking two strong thunderstorms near Waterloo, or 13 miles east of Stockton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch accumulating hail and heavy rain. Funnel clouds are also possible with these cells. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stockton, Waterloo, Garden Acres, Taft Mosswood, Kennedy, August, Camanche Reservoir, Wallace, Milton, Rancho Calaveras, Linden, Morada, Lockeford and French Camp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Accumulating hail could bring hazardous road conditions.
